snippet: Home prices have risen steadily since the spring of 2012, but are now slowing a bit. The Fed’s coming taper, and how it affects mortgage rates, may contribute to that, economists say.
abstract: Home prices have risen steadily since the spring of 2012, but are now slowing a bit, with prices in major metro areas rising 0.2 percent between September and October 2013; economists say Federal Reserve’s planned limits on stimulus spending, and how it affects mortgage rates, may contribute to that.
lead_paragraph: Home prices have risen steadily since the spring of 2012, but are now slowing a bit. The Fed’s coming taper, and how it affects mortgage rates, may contribute to that, economists say.

headline.main: House Prices Rise Again, but the Pace Could Slow
headline.print_headline: House Prices Rise Again, But the Pace Could Slow
